posts.name: Yuri
posts.cooked: Hi guys, I’m part of a team from Brazil and my teammate asked me to ask what would be a better idea for a claw, whether it should have 3 or 2 points to grab the algae.

posts.name: Josh
posts.cooked:
I’m guessing they mean 2/3 points of contact. But that really depends on if you want to follow a certain type of claw. The three I’ve seen are

huge algae claws

using coral grabbers for claws

or just algae add-ons.

It also just depends on where the claw will be, because if it’s mounted to an elevator, then you could just use a coral grabber if you make it sturdy. But I couldn’t give you advice if you were planning on an arm, wrist, elbow, etc.

posts.cooked: That’s what he meant by 3-pronged claw

posts.name: Josh
posts.cooked:
I see. I think you’ll find this team’s design very nice.

Team SCREAM 4522 and Team SCREAM Jr 4766 | Build Blog 2025 FRC Open Alliance

Credit where credit’s due for their awesome idea. However I don’t think you guys will need three prongs if you have a real solid grip on the coral and algae

posts.name: Yuri
posts.cooked: One last question. My mentor asked what do you think about throwing the algae onto the barge with the three-pronged claw?

posts.name: Josh
posts.cooked:
That’s really up to your team to decide, but it’s definitely possible and I could give you pros and cons if you want.

This bot did a good job of showing how it’s possible, but it’s up to your team to decide if you want to do that.

posts.custom_user_title: FTC 6603 Project Manager | Former Disruptive Innovator FRC 6317

posts.name: Yuri
posts.cooked: If you could give me the pros and cons, that would be awesome.

posts.name: Pedro Lima
posts.cooked:
vocês já deram uma olhada no design do pegador da equipe 4481? é uma ideia bem fácil de ser feita e bem leve! eles tem uma build thread bem completa. Como é um mecanismo bem leve, ele pode ser acoplado com ou outro para manipular os Algas em uma torre. Isso possibilita a retirada das bolas do Reef de uma maneira mais fácil. O Ri3D da Penn State faz um mecanismo de uma bem eficiente!

Pra Gringo lê: Have you guys taken a look at the design of team 4481’s intake? It’s a very easy and light idea to do! they have a very complete build thread. As it is a very light mechanism, it can be coupled with another to manipulate the Algae in a tower. This makes it easier to remove balls from the Reef. Penn State’s Ri3D makes a very efficient engine!
